content: [egil] "Aleo says we're destined to bring all clans together."
[egil] "Alette, I love you."
[egil] "Alette, I love you."
[egil] "Alette, it's a miracle that I'm still alive, so I've got to tell you something before my luck fades."
[egil] "Alette, you're the strongest and smartest woman I've ever known."
[egil] "And you don't have to love me back, but I had to say it."
[egil] "But if things ever settle down, in Arberrang or wherever, maybe we can talk."
[egil] "Don't feel like you have to say anything. Honestly."
[egil $hero] "Alette, it's a miracle that I'm still alive, so I've got to tell you something before my luck fades."

content.option: "Don't say that. We'll keep each other alive."

content: [egil] "If and when you know you love me too, you come find me, okay?"
[egil] "I hope this doesn't change anything between us."
[egil] "I...I didn't want to force it out like that, but I needed you to hear it from me."

content.option: "We can talk about this again in Arberrang."
"I wish you hadn't have said that."

content: [egil] "I...I should've had my shield up for that one, huh?"
[egil] "I just needed you to hear it from me and I'm glad you wanted to hear it."
[egil] "I knew that was a possibility, but..."
[egil] "I'm actually glad you're not saying anything because you don't need to."
[egil] "It's still neat to think we're part of something bigger."
[egil] "I've felt this way a long time, so the only difference is now we both know."
[egil] "N...no. It doesn't have to."
[egil] "None of that changes the fact that I love you."
[egil] "Only if you want to. I won't hold you to it."
[egil] "Really? Why?"
/=Egil shrugs.=/
[egil] "Sorry. Aleo tried to help me put my thoughts into words."
[egil] "Thank you, but neither one of us could have saved each other like Eyvind saved Juno."
/=The young man's shoulders start to droop, but he summons his courage.=/
[egil] "Well, I'm glad I said it. Thanks for not leading me on."
[egil] "We've come all this way. We've fought dredge, killed a Sundr."
[egil] "What? But we're...I mean, Lauga's godstone--"
[egil] "Yes. Beautiful."
/=You hear the unmistakable clank of Egil's shield behind you.=/
[egil] "Your beauty shames...the dawn's light on a clear spring morning."
[egil] "You've got the clan to save and I don't want to be another concern for you."
[egil] "You...you were?"
/=Gil stands taller and steps closer to you.=/
/=He exhales, relieved of a great burden.=/

content.option: "Thank you, Gil, but I don't feel the same way."

content: /=He isn't looking at the godstone.=/
/=He listens and allows your words to set in.=/
/=He looks up the godstone and takes a deep breath before smiling and leaving you to your thoughts.=/
/=He proudly walks away with you watching him go.=/
[$hero] "Aleo's a skald, Gil. Storytelling is his job."
[$hero] "Because it makes things different between you and me now.
[$hero] "Don't act so surprised! You're a brave fighter who always treats me with respect."
[$hero] "I hope you know I feel strongly for you, but until everyone is safe in Arberrang--"
[$hero] "I need to focus on what the caravan is doing next, so you'll have to excuse me."
[$hero] "It's just a godstone. The gods are dead."
[$hero] "Lauga's godstone is beautiful, isn't it?"
[$hero] "Okay, giant Serpents aren't part of our deal."
[$hero] "That's a big difference, Gil."
[$hero] "That sounds good, Gil. Thank you."
[$hero] "We're here for a short rest before continuing on to Arberrang - the clansmen aren't safe yet."
